page.title: 11LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN THE HORSFORD ARE IS THE{PARISH COUNCIL, P.C..}THEIR ELECTIONS ARE HELD EVERY 4 YEARS WHEN 12 COUNCILLORS ARE ELECTED. ONE BECOMES THE CHAIRMAN, ONE THE VICE-CHAIRMAN AND THE NON-VOTING CLERK,CURRENTLY MR.J.R.SPARK. HE HAS HELD THE POST FOR 47 YEARS AND IS PAID AN ANNUAL SALARY. HE MAKES HANDWRITTEN MINUTES OF ALL P.C. MEETINGS AND SEES TO ALL CORRESPONDENCE. THE FIRST P.C. WAS ELECTED IN 1894 WITH A PRECEPT OF Â£11 FROM A PARISH RATE. PRECEPT FOR 1985/6 IS Â£5400. P.C. WORK IS SUBDIVIDED INTO COMMITTEES; FINANCE PLANNING AND ALLOTMENTS. THE VILLAGE HALL AND RECREATION GROUND ARE CONTROLLED BY THE P.C. LOCAL BYE-LAWS FORBID TAKING DOGS OR RIDING BICYCLES ON THE REC. GROUND. FULL MEETINGS OF THE P.C. ARE HELD MONTHLY AND COMMITTEES AS REQUIRED.
